alert.note: Alert for Hansford (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 28 at 4:30PM CDT until May 30 at 3:32PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN HUTCHINSON...SOUTHERN HANSFORD...NORTHWESTERN ROBERTS AND SOUTHWESTERN OCHILTREE COUNTIES... At 430 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southeast of Morse, or 16 miles southwest of Spearman, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Hail may accumulate on roadways causing hazardous travel. Locations impacted include... Spearman, Morse and Pringle. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
